title: Arsenal news: Gunners 'interested in Scunthorpe's 16-year-old midfielder Joey Dawson'
text:
Arsenal are reportedly interested in bringing Scunthorpe's 16-year-old midfielder Joey Dawson to the Emirates.

Dawson, who has featured in one match for the League Two side this season, is the nephew of former Tottenham centre back Michael Dawson and son of ex-Scunthorpe and Hull defender Andy.

The Gunners want to acquire the services of Scunthorpe's youngest first-team player, according to The Sun.

Arsenal are reportedly interested in bringing Scunthorpe midfielder Joey Dawson to Emirates

Dawson's first appearance of the 2019-20 campaign came in Scunthorpe's 1-0 defeat by Championship outfit Derby in the Carabao Cup in August.

Arsenal manager Unai Emery has opted for youth so far this season with the likes of Reiss Nelson, Joe Willock, Gabriel Martinelli and Bukayo Saka featuring.

Nineteen-year-old Nelson has made six appearances this campaign, Willock, 20, has played in 10 games, 18-year-old Martinelli has scored four goals in four matches while Saka, 18, has also made six appearances.

The Gunners are currently third in the Premier League table, nine points behind leaders Liverpool after eight games.

Emery's side will be looking to make it three wins out of three in all competitions in October when they travel to Sheffield United a week on Monday.

Scunthorpe midfielder Dawson is nephew of former Tottenham centre back Michael Dawson
description: Dawson, who has featured in one match for the League Two side this season, is the nephew of former Tottenham centre back Michael Dawson and son of ex-Scunthorpe and Hull defender Andy.
